item.title: Report I-2024100135
item.description:
Report I-2024100135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: Chattanooga
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 10/02/2024 drums were picked up from Univar Solutions Norcross facility and delivered to Univar Solutions in Chattanooga. When arriving in Chattanooga the supervisor at the plant noticed a small amount of product coming out of the trailer towards the nose. When opening the door there was one drum of 40 discovered to be leaking. Hepaco was called on site and maintained/handled the cleanup. It was discovered that a drum was punctured by a nail on a pallet losing approximately 3301bs of sodium bisulfite. It looked like the drum may have shifted slightly and hit the nail. When leaving Norcross there were not any issues or signs of damage to the drum.

item.title: Report X-2024100827
item.description:
Report X-2024100827

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 09/18/2024, while working in MP31 track, Presidents Island Yard, Memphis, TN, FRA Inspector Mr. Ken Barefield observed a dark liquid leaking from the top of PROX70548, (Load, Environmentally Hazardous Substance, Liquid N.O.S., (Benzo (b) Fluoranthene, Benzo (A) Pyrene, Contain S), UN3082) down the side of the tank car to the ground. FRA Inspector Barefield notified CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan. FRA Inspector Barefield advised that 6 of the 8 nuts on the manway cover bolts were ?less than tool tight?. CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) Vaughan performed an inspection of the tank car and found the 6 of 8 nuts on the manway cover bolts to be ?less than tool tight?. Upon further inspection, the manway cover was opened, and the manway cover gasket was observed to be broken. The shipper applied cable seal # 471609 was observed in place and intact at the time of the release. The responding CN Dangerous Goods Officer (DGO) removed the existing manway cover gasket segments, then cleaned the sealing surfaces of the manway cover and the rim nozzle and were inspected for metal burs. Product residue on the manway cover and rim nozzle was removed using a cleaner and absorbents. A new rim nozzle gasket made of ?Viton A?, was properly installed and secured using a 18" pipe wrench to tighten the manway cover bolts ?tool tight?. Product spillage on the sides of the tank car, loader platform handrails and walking boards along with other safety appliances were cleaned using a cleaning solution recommended by the consignee and absorbents. Tank car was secured and released to CN Transportation for delivery to consignee. New Seals # CNDG 200031-Manway, CNDG 000980-Protective Housing, CNDG 200033-Bottom Outlet Valve Cap, CNDG 000984-Bottom Outlet Valve Handle and Securing Pin, were applied.

item.description:
Report E-2024100481

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: KNOXVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, one (1) can of lithium was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) tablespoon of product to the box containing it. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel placed the damaged container of product into one (1) 5-gallon bucket and staged it on the trailer to be taken back to the terminal as product.

item.title: Report E-2024100479
item.description:
Report E-2024100479

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: PIONEER
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 had a loose cap during transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized soda ash, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024100480
item.description:
Report E-2024100480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 9, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent and absorbents to remediate the site. The damaged pail and all impacted absorbents were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles packaged with styrofoam holders top and bottom and packaged in plastic bags. One of the glass bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was dropped during the loading process. The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles packaged with styrofoam holders top and bottom and packaged in plastic bags. One of the glass bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
